decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be completed before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and condition 5 of Schedule 2, Part 3, Class MA of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 as amended. | The building permitted to be used as a dwellinghouse by virtue of Class MA shall remain in use as a dwellinghouse within the meaning of Class C3 of Schedule 1 to the Use Classes Order and for no other purpose, except to the extent that the other purpose is ancillary to the use as a dwellinghouse.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and condition 6 of Schedule 2, Part 3, Class MA of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 as amended. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): MB/3960/2 (Existing Plans),  MB/3960/3 (Proposed Plans),

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Cycle storage for a minimum of 6 bicycles, shall be provided onsite in accordance with all adopted standards prior to occupation of the proposed residential unit and be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved. Cycle storage shall be secure and covered.
Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and policy T5 of the London Plan (2021).
description: Change of use from two floor office (Use Class MA-Class E) to 3 residential flats (Use Class C3) (Class O, 56 day Prior Approval Process)
